nodes.content: Handles an HTTP response object and returns it to the client.

Processes an HTTP response and returns it to the requesting client. This function typically completes the HTTP request–response cycle by delivering the server’s final output, such as headers, status codes, and body content, back to the client.
The response object that will be returned to the client.
Takes an HTTP response object and transmits it to the requesting client. This parameter represents the final output of the server, including headers, status code, and body content.
Constructs an HTTP request object using the specified method, headers, URL, and payload.
Generates an HTTP request object that can be sent to a server. The request includes an HTTP method, optional headers, a destination URL, and an optional request body.
Defines the HTTP method to be used, such as GET, POST, PUT, or DELETE.
Specifies the request method that determines the type of HTTP operation to perform.
A collection of key-value pairs containing additional request metadata.
Optional headers that can define content type, authorization, cookies, caching policies, and more.
The target URL to which the HTTP request will be sent.
Specifies the endpoint address, including protocol, host, path, and query parameters, where the request is directed.
The data to include in the body of the request, typically used with methods like POST or PUT.
Contains the request payload, such as JSON, XML, form data, or binary content, depending on the Content-Type header.
Builds an HTTP response object using the specified status code, headers, and optional response body.
Creates a complete HTTP response object to be returned from a server. The response includes a status code, headers, and an optional body containing the response content.
Represents the numeric status code returned by the server in response to an HTTP request.
Indicates the outcome of an HTTP request. Common codes include 200 (OK), 201 (Created), 400 (Bad Request), 401 (Unauthorized), 404 (Not Found), and 500 (Internal Server Error).
A collection of key-value pairs containing additional request metadata.
Optional headers that can define content type, authorization, cookies, caching policies, and more.
The data to include in the body of the request, typically used with methods like POST or PUT.
Contains the request payload, such as JSON, XML, form data, or binary content, depending on the Content-Type header.
Retrieves the element at a specified index from a list.
Returns the element located at the given zero-based index within the input list.
The list from which to retrieve an element.
A list containing elements of any type. The element at the specified index will be returned.
The zero-based index of the element to retrieve.
Specifies the position of the element in the list to return. Must be within the bounds of the list.
Concatenates two lists into a single list.
Returns a new list containing all elements of the first list followed by all elements of the second list.
The first input list whose elements will appear at the beginning of the resulting list.
The second input list whose elements will be appended after the elements of the first list.
Filters elements of a list based on a predicate.
Returns a new list containing only the elements from the input list for which the predicate returns true.
Filter out elements in ${list} not matching ${predicate}
The original list from which elements will be selected based on the predicate.
A predicate function to test each element for inclusion in the result.
A function that takes an element of the list and returns a boolean indicating whether the element should be included in the output list.
Finds the first element in the list that satisfies the predicate.
Returns the first element from the input list for which the predicate returns true. If no element matches, returns null or equivalent.
The list in which an element satisfying the predicate will be searched.
A predicate function used to test each element for a match.
A function that takes an element of the list and returns a boolean indicating if the element matches the search criteria.
Finds the index of the first element in the list that satisfies the predicate.
Returns the zero-based index of the first element for which the predicate returns true. If no element matches, returns -1.
The list in which to find the index of an element that satisfies the predicate.
A predicate function used to test each element for a match.
A function that takes an element of the list and returns a boolean indicating if the element satisfies the search criteria.
Finds the last element in the list that satisfies the predicate.
Returns the last element from the input list for which the predicate returns true. If no element matches, returns null or equivalent.
The list in which an element satisfying the predicate will be searched.
A predicate function used to test each element for a match.
A function that takes an element of the list and returns a boolean indicating if the element matches the search criteria.
Retrieves the first element from the list.
This runtime returns the first element in the given list, if any.
The list from which to retrieve the first element.
Returns the first element of the provided list. If the list is empty, behavior depends on the implementation.
Flattens a nested list into a single-level list.
Returns a new list by concatenating all sub-lists of the input nested list into one flat list.
The nested list to be flattened.
A list containing sub-lists that will be flattened into a single-level list.
Executes a consumer function for each element in the list.
This runtime executes the given consumer function on each item in the list without returning a result.
The list of elements to iterate over.
Each element of this list will be passed to the provided consumer function for processing.
A function that consumes each element of the list.
This function is invoked once for each element in the list. It is not expected to return a value.
Finds the index of the first occurrence of the specified item in the list.
Returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of a given item in the specified list. If the item is not found, it typically returns -1.
A list of elements in which the specified item will be searched for to determine its index.
The item whose index is to be found in the list.
The item for which the function searches in the list and returns the index of its first occurrence.
Checks if the list has no elements.
Returns true if the list contains no elements, otherwise returns false.
The list to check for emptiness.
The list whose length will be evaluated to determine if it contains any elements.
Filters the input text list and joins the filtered elements into a single string separated by the specified join text.
Applies a filter operation on the input text list and returns a single concatenated string of filtered elements joined by the provided join text.
A list of text elements to be filtered.
Input list containing text elements for filtering.
Text to join the filtered elements.
The delimiter or text that will be used to join the filtered list elements into a single string.
Retrieves the last element from the list.
This runtime returns the last element in the given list, if any.
The list from which to retrieve the last element.
Returns the last element of the provided list. If the list is empty, behavior depends on the implementation.
Transforms each element in the list using the provided function.
This runtime applies the transform function to each element in the list, producing a new list of the results.
Each element of this list will be passed through the transform function.
A function that transforms each item in the list.
The transform function is applied to every element of the list to produce a new list.
Finds the maximum value in a numeric list.
Returns the largest number contained in the provided list.
A list of numbers to find the maximum value from.
Returns the largest number in the given list of numbers.
Finds the minimum value in a numeric list.
Returns the smallest number contained in the provided list.
A list of numbers to find the minimum value from.
Returns the smallest number in the given list of numbers.
Removes and returns the last item from the list.
Removes the last element from the specified list and returns it. The list is modified in place.
The list to remove the last item from.
This is the list from which the last element will be removed and returned.
Appends an item to the end of a list.
Adds a new element to the end of the list and returns the new length of the list.
The list to which an item will be added.
The list that the new item will be appended to.
The item to add to the list.
The value to be added at the end of the list.
Removes the first occurrence of the specified item from the list.
Removes the first matching item from the given list and returns the resulting list.
The list from which the item will be removed.
A list to process by removing the first occurrence of the specified item.
The item to remove from the list.
The value to search for and remove from the list. Only the first matching item is removed.
Reverses the order of elements in the list.
Returns a new list with the elements of the input list in reverse order.
The input list to be reversed.
A list of elements whose order will be reversed.
Returns the number of elements in the list.
This function returns the count of elements present in the given list.
The list whose number of elements is to be returned.
Specifies the list for which the total number of elements will be calculated and returned.
Sorts the elements of the list using the specified comparator.
Returns a new list with the elements sorted according to the comparator function provided.
The input list to be sorted.
A list of elements that will be sorted using the provided comparator function.
A comparator function used to determine the sort order of elements.
A function that takes two elements and returns a negative, zero, or positive number to indicate their ordering.
Sorts the elements of the list in reverse order using the specified comparator.
Returns a new list with the elements sorted in descending order according to the comparator function provided.
The input list to be sorted in reverse order.
A list of elements that will be sorted in descending order using the provided comparator.
A comparator function used to determine the sort order of elements.
A function that takes two elements and returns a negative, zero, or positive number to indicate their ordering.
Returns the total sum of the elements in the numeric list.
Adds up all numbers in the input list and returns their sum.
A list of numbers to be summed.
Calculates the sum of all numbers in the given list.
Removes duplicate elements from the input list.
Returns a new list containing only the unique elements from the input list. The original order may or may not be preserved depending on the implementation.
The input list from which duplicates will be removed.
A list of elements that may contain duplicates. This function will remove any duplicate items and return a new list with unique values only.
Will convert the boolean to a number.
Converts a boolean value to a number.
Converts a boolean value to a number.
Will convert the boolean to text.
Converts a boolean value to a text string.
Converts a boolean value to a text string.
Will convert the number to a boolean.
Converts a number to a boolean value. Typically, 0 maps to false and non-zero maps to true.
Converts a number to a boolean value.
Will convert the string to a boolean.
Converts a text string to a boolean value. Recognizes 'true' and 'false' (case-insensitive).
Converts a text string to a boolean value.
Will check if the two booleans are equal.
Compares two boolean values for equality. Returns true if they are the same, false otherwise.
The first boolean value to compare.
The second boolean value to compare.
Executes the specified runnable if the condition evaluates to true.

The 'If' runnable evaluates a boolean condition and, if it is true, executes the provided runnable. If the condition is false, execution continues without running the runnable. This behavior corresponds to a standard 'if' statement in programming languages.

Specifies the condition that determines whether the provided runnable should be executed. If this condition evaluates to true, the execution proceeds with the runnable defined in the second parameter.
Runnable to execute when the condition is true.
Defines the runnable that runs if the condition evaluates to true.
Evaluates a condition and executes either the Then Runnable or the Else Runnable.
Evaluates a boolean condition. If true, executes the Then Runnable; otherwise, executes the Else Runnable. Mirrors a standard 'if/else' control structure in programming languages.
Determines which branch to execute. If true the Then Runnable runs otherwise the Else Runnable runs.
Runnable to execute when the condition is true.
Defines the runnable that runs if the condition evaluates to true.
Runnable to execute when the condition is false.
Defines the runnable that runs if the condition evaluates to false.
Returns a value and terminates the current context.

Ends the current context and returns the specified value to the upper scope. This node behaves like a standard 'return' statement in programming languages, stopping further execution within the current flow.
The value to be returned to the upper context.
Specifies the value that will be returned to the upper context. When this node executes, it immediately halts the iteration and passes the value upward.
Completely stops the current context and prevents any further iterations.

Terminates the current execution context entirely, halting all ongoing and future iterations. Once invoked, no additional steps or loops within this context will be executed. This node behaves like a global stop or termination signal within the flow.
Returns the absolute value of a number.
Removes the sign from the input number, returning its non-negative value.
The number for which to compute the absolute value.
This is the numeric input. The result will be its absolute (non-negative) value.
Returns the arccosine of a number, in radians.
Computes the angle in radians whose cosine is the given number.
The number representing the cosine value, must be between -1 and 1.
Calculates the arccosine (inverse cosine) of the input value.
Returns the arcsine of a number, in radians.
Computes the angle in radians whose sine is the given number.
The number representing the sine value, must be between -1 and 1.
Calculates the arcsine (inverse sine) of the input value.
Returns the arctangent of a number, in radians.
Computes the angle in radians whose tangent is the given number.
The number representing the tangent value.
Calculates the arctangent (inverse tangent) of the input value.
Converts a number into its textual representation.
Transforms the given numeric value into a string format.
The number to convert to text.
The numeric input that will be converted to its text representation.
Limits a number to be within a specified range.
Returns the given number clamped between the minimum and maximum bounds.
The number to be clamped within the range.
The input number that will be limited to the specified range.
The lower bound of the clamping range.
The minimum allowed value in the clamping operation.
The upper bound of the clamping range.
The maximum allowed value in the clamping operation.
Returns the cosine of the specified angle in radians.
Calculates the cosine value of the input angle measured in radians.
The angle in radians to compute the cosine of.
Computes the cosine of the given angle in radians.
Returns the hyperbolic cosine of a number.
Calculates the hyperbolic cosine (cosh) of the input value.
The number for which to calculate the hyperbolic cosine.
Computes the hyperbolic cosine of the given number.
Divides the first number by the second number.
Returns the result of dividing the first numeric input (dividend) by the second (divisor).
This is the numerator or the number that will be divided by the second value.
The number by which to divide the first number.
This is the denominator or the value that divides the first number.
Returns the mathematical constant e (Euler's number).
Provides the constant value of Euler's number, approximately 2.71828, which is the base of the natural logarithm.
Raises a base number to the power of an exponent.
Computes the result of raising the base to the power specified by the exponent.
The base number to be raised to a power.
This is the numeric value that will be raised to the power of the exponent.
The exponent to raise the base number by.
This numeric value indicates the power to which the base is raised.
Converts a text string into a number if possible.
Attempts to parse the provided text input and return its numeric equivalent.
The text string to convert to a number.
Parses the input text and attempts to convert it to a numeric value.
Returns the mathematical concept of positive infinity.
Provides the representation of positive infinity, used to represent an unbounded value in computations.
Checks whether two numbers are equal.
Returns true if the first number is equal to the second number, otherwise false.
The first operand in the equality check.
The second operand in the equality check.
Checks whether the first number is greater than the second number.
Returns true if the first numeric input is greater than the second; otherwise, returns false.
The number to compare against the second number.
This is the number that will be evaluated to determine if it is greater than the second number.
The number to compare with the first number.
This is the number that the first number will be compared to.
Checks whether the first number is less than the second number.
Returns true if the first numeric input is less than the second; otherwise, returns false.
The number to compare with the second number.
This is the number that will be evaluated to determine if it is less than the second number.
The number to compare against the first number.
This is the number that the first number will be compared to.
Checks whether a number is greater than zero.
Evaluates the input number and returns true if it is positive (greater than zero), otherwise false.
The number to check for positivity.
This is the numeric input that will be evaluated to determine whether it is greater than zero.
Checks whether the given number is exactly zero.
Returns true if the input number is zero; otherwise, returns false.
The number to check if it is zero.
This is the numeric input evaluated to determine whether it equals zero.
Calculates the natural logarithm (log base e) of a number.
Returns the natural logarithm of the given value.
The number to compute the natural logarithm for.
The numeric input whose natural logarithm (log base e) will be calculated.
Calculates the logarithm of a number with respect to a specified base.
Returns the logarithm of the given value using the specified base.
The number to compute the logarithm for.
The numeric input whose logarithm is to be calculated.
Specifies the logarithmic base to use (e.g., 10 for common log, e for natural log).
Returns the larger of two numbers.
Compares two numbers and returns the maximum value.
One of the two numbers for which the maximum value will be determined.
The other number involved in the maximum value comparison.
Returns the smaller of two numbers.
Compares two numbers and returns the minimum value.
One of the two numbers for which the minimum value will be determined.
The other number involved in the minimum value comparison.
Returns the remainder after dividing the first number by the second.
Computes the modulus (remainder) of dividing the first numeric input by the second.
The number to be divided to find the remainder.
This is the number that will be divided by the second value to calculate the remainder.
The number by which the first number is divided to get the remainder.
This is the number used to divide the dividend and obtain the remainder.
Takes two numeric inputs and returns their product.
Specifies the first operand in the multiplication operation.
Specifies the second operand in the multiplication operation.
Returns the negation of a number (multiplies by -1).
Calculates the additive inverse of the given number.
The numeric input whose sign will be inverted.
Provides the constant value of pi, approximately 3.14159, used in many mathematical calculations.
Generates a random number between the specified minimum and maximum values.
Returns a randomly generated number within the given range, inclusive of both minimum and maximum.
The minimum value in the random number range.
Defines the lower bound (inclusive) for the random number generation.
The maximum value in the random number range.
Defines the upper bound (inclusive) for the random number generation.
Returns the root of a number given a root exponent.
Calculates the nth root of the input number, where n is specified by the root exponent.
The number from which the root will be extracted.
The numeric input for which the root will be calculated.
The degree of the root to extract.
Specifies which root to calculate (e.g., 2 for square root, 3 for cube root).
Rounds a number to the nearest value at the specified number of decimal places.
Performs standard rounding on the given value, rounding up or down depending on the fractional component.
The numeric input that will be rounded to the nearest value.
The number of decimal places to round to.
Specifies how many decimal digits to keep after rounding.
Rounds a number downward to the specified number of decimal places.
Performs rounding on the given value, always rounding down to the nearest value at the given decimal precision.
The number to be rounded down.
The numeric input that will be rounded downwards.
The number of decimal places to round down to.
Specifies how many decimal digits to keep after rounding down.
Rounds a number upward to the specified number of decimal places.
Performs rounding on the given value, always rounding up to the nearest value at the given decimal precision.
The number to be rounded up.
The numeric input that will be rounded upwards.
The number of decimal places to round up to.
Specifies how many decimal digits to keep after rounding up.
Returns the sine of a number.
Calculates the sine of the input value.
The number for which to calculate the sine.
Computes the sine of the given number.
Returns the hyperbolic sine of a number.
Calculates the hyperbolic sine (sinh) of the input value.
The number for which to calculate the hyperbolic sine.
Computes the hyperbolic sine of the given number.
Returns the square of the given number.
Calculates the value multiplied by itself, effectively raising it to the power of 2.
This is the numeric input that will be multiplied by itself.
Returns the square root of the given number.
Calculates the positive square root of the input number.
The number to find the square root of.
The numeric input for which the square root will be calculated.
Subtracts the second number from the first number.
Returns the result of subtracting the second numeric input from the first.
The number from which another number (the subtrahend) is to be subtracted.
This is the number that will have the second value subtracted from it.
The number to subtract from the first number (the minuend).
This is the value that will be subtracted from the first number.
Returns the tangent of the specified angle in radians.
Calculates the tangent value of the input angle measured in radians.
The angle in radians to compute the tangent of.
Computes the tangent of the given angle in radians.
Checks whether the specified key exists in the object.
Returns true if the given key is a property of the object; otherwise, returns false.
The object to check for the presence of a key.
The object within which the existence of the specified key will be checked.
The key to check for existence in the object.
The property key whose presence in the object is being tested.
Retrieves all the keys from the given object as a list of text values.
Returns a list containing all enumerable property names (keys) of the specified object.
The object whose keys will be retrieved.
Returns a list of all the keys (property names) of the given object.
Sets or updates a key-value pair in the given object.
Returns a new object with the specified key set to the given value.
The object in which the key-value pair will be set.
The original object that will be modified with the specified key-value pair.
The key to set or update in the object.
The property name under which the value will be stored in the object.
The value to set for the specified key.
The value to assign to the object property identified by the key.
Calculates the number of keys in the provided object.
Returns an integer count of all enumerable property keys in the specified object.
The object whose size (number of keys) will be calculated.
Returns the number of enumerable keys (properties) present in the given object.
Concatenates the suffix text to the end of the original text.
Returns a new text string consisting of the original text followed by the specified suffix.
The initial text to which the suffix will be appended.
The base text string that will have another string appended to its end.
The text to append to the original value.
The text string that will be concatenated to the end of the original text.
Converts a text string into a list of byte values.
Returns a list of bytes representing the UTF-8 encoding of the given text.
The text to convert into bytes.
Converts the input text string into a list of byte values.
Returns the character at the specified index in the text.
Retrieves a single character from the input text based on the provided zero-based index.
The text string from which to extract the character.
The input text from which a character will be retrieved by index.
The zero-based position of the character to extract.
Specifies which character to return from the text.
Returns the number of bytes required to encode the given text.
Computes the size in bytes of the provided text string, typically by counting UTF-8 encoded bytes.
The text whose byte size is to be calculated.
Calculates the size in bytes of the given text, typically its UTF-8 encoding length.
Converts the first character of the text to uppercase and leaves the rest unchanged.
Returns a new text string with the first letter capitalized.
Capitalizes the first letter of the input text string.
Returns a list containing each character from the given text string.
Creates a list where each element is a single character from the original text.
Turns ${value} into a list of characters
The text string to split into characters.
Splits the input text string into a list of its constituent characters.
Checks if the main text contains the specified substring.
Returns true if the substring is found anywhere in the main text; otherwise, returns false.
The main text to search within.
The main text to search within.
The text to search for inside the main text.
The text to search for inside the main text.
Decodes the input text from the specified encoding format.
Decodes the input text from the specified encoding format.
The decoding scheme to apply (e.g. Base64).
The decoding scheme to apply (e.g. Base64).
Encodes the input text into the specified encoding format.
Transforms the given text string into a representation encoded by the specified encoding scheme.
The encoding scheme to apply (e.g., UTF-8, Base64).
The encoding scheme to apply (e.g., UTF-8, Base64).
Checks if the input text ends with the specified suffix.
Returns true if the input text ends with the given suffix; otherwise, returns false.
The suffix to test against the input text.
The suffix to test against the input text.
Converts a list of ASCII codes back into the corresponding text string.
Takes a list of numbers where each number is an ASCII code, and returns the string they represent.
List of ASCII numeric codes representing characters.
List of ASCII numeric codes representing characters.
Converts a text string into a hexadecimal representation.
Returns a string containing the hexadecimal values corresponding to each character of the input text.
The text string to be converted to its hexadecimal representation.
This function converts each character of the input text into its corresponding hexadecimal code, returning the concatenated hex string.
Finds the first occurrence index of the substring within the text.
Returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of the substring in the text. Returns -1 if the substring is not found.
The text string to search within.
The text string to search within.
The substring to find inside the text.
The substring to find inside the text.
Inserts a given text into the original text at the specified position.
Returns a new string where the provided text is inserted at the zero-based position index within the original text.
The original text into which another text will be inserted.
This is the base string where the insertion happens.
The index at which the text will be inserted.
Zero-based index indicating where the new text should be inserted.
The text that will be inserted into the original text.
The substring to be inserted at the specified position.
Checks whether the two input text strings are equal.
Determines if the two given text inputs are exactly the same, returning true if equal, false otherwise.
The first text string to compare.
The first input text for equality comparison.
The second text string to compare.
The second input text for equality comparison.
Returns the number of characters in the given text.
Computes the length of the input string in terms of characters.
The text whose length will be calculated.
Input string to determine the number of characters it contains.
Transforms all letters in the text to their lowercase equivalents.
Returns a new text string with all characters converted to lowercase.
The text string to convert to lowercase.
Converts all characters in the input text string to lowercase.
Converts a text string into an octal representation.
Returns a string containing the octal values corresponding to each character of the input text.
The text string to be converted to its octal representation.
This function converts each character of the input text into its corresponding octal code, returning the concatenated octal string.
Concatenates the prefix text to the beginning of the original text.
Returns a new text string consisting of the specified prefix followed by the original text.
The initial text to which the prefix will be added.
The base text string that will have another string prepended to its beginning.
The text to prepend before the original value.
The text string that will be concatenated to the start of the original text.
Removes the substring between the specified start and end indices from the input text.
Returns a new string with characters removed from start up to but not including end.
The original text to remove a substring from.
The input text from which a substring will be removed.
The zero-based index where removal begins.
The starting position for removing characters from the text.
The zero-based index where removal ends (exclusive).
The position just after the last character to be removed.
Replaces all occurrences of a specified substring with another substring in the input text.
Returns a new string where every instance of the old substring is replaced by the new substring.
The input text where replacements will be made.
This is the text in which all occurrences of the old substring will be replaced.
All occurrences of this substring in the original text will be replaced.
This substring will replace each occurrence of the old substring.
Replaces the first occurrence of a specified substring with another substring in the input text.
Returns a new string where only the first instance of the old substring is replaced by the new substring.
The input text where the first replacement will be made.
This text contains the substring that will be replaced only once—the first occurrence.
Only the first occurrence of this substring will be replaced in the original text.
This substring will replace only the first occurrence of the old substring.
Replaces the last occurrence of a specified substring with another substring in the input text.
Returns a new string where only the last instance of the old substring is replaced by the new substring.
The input text where the last replacement will be made.
This text contains the substring that will be replaced only once—the last occurrence.
Only the last occurrence of this substring will be replaced in the original text.
This substring will replace only the last occurrence of the old substring.
Reverses the characters in the input text.
Returns a new string with the characters of the input text in reverse order.
The input text to be reversed.
The input text to be reversed.
Splits the input text into a list of substrings based on the specified delimiter.
Returns a list of substrings obtained by splitting the input text at each occurrence of the delimiter.
The input text to be split.
The input text to be split.
The delimiter string to split the text by.
The delimiter string to split the text by.
Checks if the input text starts with the specified prefix.
Returns true if the input text begins with the given prefix; otherwise, returns false.
The prefix to test against the input text.
The prefix to test against the input text.
Converts uppercase letters to lowercase and lowercase letters to uppercase in the given text.
Returns a new text string with the case of each character inverted.
The text string whose case will be swapped.
Swaps the case of each letter in the input text: uppercase letters become lowercase, and vice versa.
Converts each character of the input text into its corresponding ASCII numerical code.
Returns a list of numbers where each number represents the ASCII code of the corresponding character in the input text.
Input text to convert to ASCII codes.
Input text to convert to ASCII codes.
Removes leading and trailing whitespace from the text.
Returns a new string with all leading and trailing whitespace characters removed from the input text.
The text string to trim whitespace from.
The input text from which leading and trailing whitespace characters will be removed.
Transforms all letters in the text to their uppercase equivalents.
Returns a new text string with all characters converted to uppercase.
The text string to convert to uppercase.
Converts all characters in the input text string to uppercase.
